formalText: She thinks it is a lot of effort and work to not hurt or kill herself.
She has been writing a lot and to some extent it seems helpful and to some extent it seems like it gets her worked up.
I am feeling really worried about whether she is going to be able to do this therapy because she doesn't want to police herself for 8 hours.
She is going to keep working on getting the job at Starbucks, and I'll get back in touch with dr. Vaughn.

She is talking about the struggles of feeling like committing suicide. She is worried that I'll need to be hospitalized again. States, "the sense of Doom was a little bit too overpowering when I'm sure that I think of a job I am going to fail at.
I don't know the best time for me to fill out the application"
She feels like a prisoner in her life.
She say she doesn't hurt herself because James doesn't want her to and because she feels like she has responsibilities towards him.
She says, "I feel like such a coward , I can't do anything"
She is pretty mad at James are pretty resentful of him.
because if it weren't for him, she could just be dead and done suffering.
She feels like both James and her are blackmailing one another with caring about each other.
She feels a little more angry with herself right now than sad
I feel like I'm not good for much
like I don't have anything to offer.
She is not doing anything to make feeling a coward different. She wonders how much of that is her in just not wanting to feel like she is totally out of control.
She is not angry at me as a counselor, which she finds interesting.
She just doesn't feel like she is personally invested in the way James is personally invested in her or how other people that take care of her.
What she really wants to do is just sit around and read books. Sometimes she feels like she can change things but just can't get there.
She says, "I'm pretty angry at myself, pretty angry at the most people in my life"
James is very upset and he doesn't feel like he's allowed to be upset because it upsets her so much
She feels like her existence is hurting people she love but that if she left I would hurt them more.
